info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon, southwestern Transylvania, southeastern Jackson and northeastern Oconee Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Walhalla, or 4 miles west of Devils Fork State Park, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cashiers, Devils Fork State Park, Lake Jocassee, Oconee State Park, Sapphire, Bad Creek, Pine Mountain and Whiteside Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
